news.title: MHADA to provide ₹20,000 monthly rent for residents of 96 dangerous cessed buildings
news.para: Sanjeev Jaiswal, vice president and chief executive officer, MHADA, that tenants and residents of these buildings who independently arrange for alternate accommodation, will be provided monthly rent of ₹20,000 by the board.

news.title: Tesla secures fourth India office in Mumbai as part of expansion strategy
news.para: Tesla has leased a 24,500 sq ft office in Mumbai’s Kurla as part of its growing India presence, marking its fourth office in the country. The five-year lease, valued over ₹24 crore, follows Tesla’s recent showroom lease in BKC. These moves signal Tesla’s increasing operational focus and preparation for future manufacturing amid evolving EV policies in India.

news.title: MMRDA allots 8,411.88 sq meters commercial plot in BKC to Schloss Bangalore
news.para: The company along with its subsidiary Schloss Chanakya and Arliga Ecospace Business Parks, an affiliate of Brookfield, submitted a binding bid to lease the plot for a duration of 80 years.

news.title: Mysuru civic body to use women SHGs to collect property tax
news.para: The women will not only visit door-to-door for the collection of the water and property cess but also help them in pay via both online and offline after calculating the amount.

news.title: Steep property tax hike in Ghaziabad sparks protests
news.para: The revised rates, implemented on April 1, haven't gone down well due to an increase of up to four times the previous rates, which residents claim violates existing municipal laws that allow corporations to increase property taxes once every two years.

news.title: Westridge Investments plans to divest a 9.8% stake in Aptus Value Housing
news.para: Aptus Value Housing shares are under the spotlight as Westridge Investments plans a Rs 1,495 crore block deal to sell a 9.8% stake. The company reported a 26% rise in Q4 net profit and strong growth in assets and disbursements. Analysts maintain a ‘Buy’ rating with an average target price of Rs 388, indicating 15% upside potential.

news.title: Maharashtra: Online tenant verification in all police stations by month-end
news.para: The initiative, started in 98 police stations across Mumbai city and suburban areas, 64 stations in Pune city, and 34 in rural areas, represents a digital transformation in the tenant registration processes.

news.title: HC stays BDA action as Bengaluru apartment faces power disconnection threat
news.para: The 24-year-old apartment complex, which made headlines two years ago due to flooding, now faces risks of power disconnection and cancellation of possession certificate after the fire and emergency services department directed Bescom and BBMP to withhold approvals.

news.title: Mortgage approvals in UK drop to lowest in over a year after tax break ends
news.para: Mortgage approvals - which are typically given at least a month before a purchase completes - fell to 60,463 in April from a downwardly revised 63,603 in March.

news.title: Punjab cabinet approves land pooling policy
news.para: Under this policy, land owners can give their land either to the state government or a builder or they can develop the land on their own, he said.

news.title: NCLAT upholds insolvency proceedings against Jaypee Cement Corp
news.para: A two-member bench of the NCLAT rejected the appeal filed by Alok Gaur against the NCLT order, saying the debt and default matter is proved, and it did not find any error in the order directing the initiation of insolvency proceedings.

news.title: Emaar India to invest ₹400 crore to develop residential project in Lucknow
news.para: Developed on 2.923 acres of land, the project offers a wide range of residential units, 3BHK + U and 4BHK + U (two types).

news.title: House prices in UK rise 3.5% in May 2025: Nationwide
news.para: The seasonally adjusted monthly increase was the largest since December, while the annual gain was the second-smallest since October, after April's 3.4% rise.

news.title: Hong Kong: New World's securities tumble after coupon payments deferred
news.para: New World, which has one of the highest debt ratios among its peers and also had two CEO changes last year, said on Friday it would defer coupon payments worth $77.2 million on four perpetual bonds scheduled for June.

news.title: Meenakshi Alternates launches realty-focused ₹700 crore AIF
news.para: This SEBI-approved Category II AIF will target a mix of debt and equity investments with a total corpus of ₹700 crore (including a ₹350 crore greenshoe option). Meenakshi Group has committed up to 20% of the fund size as sponsor capital.

news.title: Gujarat government's new policy to enable cross-city transferable development rights
news.para: The policy framework proposes an inter-city TDR framework, allowing cross-city transfer of development rights in Ahmedabad, Surat, Vadodara, Rajkot and other urban centres while addressing various urban challenges.

news.title: Bhubaneswar civic body to set up three more ODA courts to resolve building plan disputes
news.para: At present, there is only one ODA court that deals with thousands of minor and major disputes, creating a huge backlog. An estimated 7,000 disputes are pending for disposal, BMC officials said.

news.title: Bengaluru civic body collects over ₹2,400 crore in property tax in Apr-May 2025
news.para: As of May 30, property tax collections stood at Rs 598.51 crore in Mahadevapura, Rs 455.06 crore in the East Zone, Rs 391.96 crore in the South Zone, Rs 270.36 crore in the West Zone, Rs 258.63 crore in Bommanahalli, Rs 197.97 crore in Yelahanka, Rs 175.27 crore in RR Nagar, and Rs 77.17 crore in Dasarahalli.

news.title: NBCC defends bulk sale of new Amrapali flats to private builders
news.para: NBCC chairperson and managing director KP Mahadevaswamy, however, maintained that the decision was necessary given the severe financial constraints.

news.title: Illegal construction begins at sector 17 collapsed building site, Chandigarh DC orders probe
news.para: While the debris of the collapsed building was cleared from the site a few days back, multiple iron columns have now come up at the spot despite the fact that the UT estate office has not approved a revised building plan for the site so far.
